name: Management and follow up of PIH/Eclampsia \Pre Eclampsia
meansOfVerification:
Monitors BP in every case,Catheterization, and tests for proteinuria if BP is >140/90 mmHg 
If BP is 140/90 mmHg or more with proteinuria 2+  along with any two of the following danger signs: severe headache, blurring of vision, severe pain abdomen or reduced urine output, BP > 160/110 or more with proteinuria 3+;  OR in cases of eclampsia—administers loading dose of Magnesium Sulphate (MgSO4) and refers/ calls for specialist attention; continues maintenance dose of MgSO4- 5 g of MgSO4 IM in alternate buttocks every four hours, for 24 hours after birth/last convulsion, whichever is later
If BP is >160/110 mmHg or more, give appropriate anti-hypertensive (Hydralazine/Methyl Dopa/ Nifedipine) Rule out Traumatic PPH

name: Management of Postpartum Haemorrhage
meansOfVerification: Assessment of bleeding (PPH if >500 ml or > 1 pad soaked in 5 Minutes. IV Fluid, bladder catheterization, measurement of urine output,  Administration of 20 IU of Oxytocin in 500 ml Normal Saline or RL at 40-60 drops per minute . Performs Bimanual Compression of Uterus

name: Management of Retained Placenta
meansOfVerification: Administration of another dose of Oxytocin 20IU in 500 ml of RL at 40-60 drops/min an attempt to deliver placenta with repeat controlled cord traction. If this fails performs manual removal of Placenta

name: Management of Uterine Atony
meansOfVerification: Vigorous Uterine massage, gives Oxytocin 20 IU in 500 ml of R/L  40 to 60 drops/minute (Continue to administer Oxytocin upto maximum of 3 litres of solution with Oxytocin) If still bleeding perform bi manual uterine compression with palpation of femoral pulse

name: Management of Obstructed Labour
meansOfVerification: Diagnoses obstructed labour based on data registered from the partograph, Re-hydrates the patient to maintain normal plasma volume, check vitals, gives broad spectrum antibiotics, perform bladder catheterization and takes blood for Hb & grouping, Decides on the mode of delivery as per the condition of mother and the baby

name: Management of Puerperal sepsis
meansOfVerification: Diagnosis puerperal sepsis based on clinical criteria: continuous fever for at least 24 hours or recurring within the first 10 days after delivery, increased pulse rate, increased respiration, offensive/foul smelling lochia, sub involution of the uterus, headache and general malaise, pelvic pain, pain, swelling and pus discharge from laceration or episiotomy or incision. Conduct appropriate lab. investigations, Prescribes IV fluids and broad spectrum antibiotics for seven days & advises perineal care

NRC has system in place to assess appetite of child based on their nutritional needs

name: NRC has system to access requirement and dose of micronutrient of SAM children as per their age
meansOfVerification: As per standards guideline

name: NRC has system to provides diet to children based on their  clinical condition/ Medical complication
meansOfVerification: Management of SAM are based on 3 phases: Stabilization Phase, Transition Phase and rehabilitation phase

name: Starter diet (F-75) is given to child just after admission.
meansOfVerification: Feeding should begin as soon as possible after admission with ‘Starter diet’ until the child is stabilized

name: Catch up diet (F-100) is given to the child.
meansOfVerification: Catch up diet is started when child is clinically stable and can tolerate increased energy and protein intake .Quantity of catch up diet  given is equal to Quantity of starter diet given in stabilization phase

name: Provision of 50% sugar solution to children on admission
meansOfVerification: on 2 phases and after rehabilitation phase as pe rthe standard guidelines

name: Feeding Protocol for the child is decided based on the results of apetite test
meansOfVerification: Feed frequency 2 hourly with 12 total feeds daily on day 1 and 3 hourly with 8 total feeds daily on day 2 and 3

name: F-75 and F-100 made as per the guideline.
meansOfVerification: F-75 and F-100 along with micronutrient supplementation refers to the specific combination of calories proteins, electrolytes and minerals that should be delivered to children with SAM as per WHO guidelines made available for this purpose.

meansOfVerification: Blood transfusion is required (1) Hb is less than 4 g/dl (2) or if there is respiratory distress and Hb is between 4 and 6 g/dl.

name: Blood is kept on optimum temperature before transfusion
Blood transfusion is monitored and regulated by qualified person
meansOfVerification: Give (1)  whole blood 10 ml/kg body weight slowly over 3 hours (2) furosemide 1 mg/kg IV at the start of the transfusion

name: Blood transfusion note is written in patient recorded
Staff is aware of conditions in which blood transfusion is not done/repeated
meansOfVerification:
(1) Blood transfusion should not be started until the child has begun to gain weight.(2) Following the transfusion, if the Hb remains
less than 4 g/dl or between 4 and 6 g/dl with continuing respiratory
distress, DO NOT repeat the transfusion within 4 days

name: Pre Test Counselling is done as per protocols
meansOfVerification:
basic information and benefits of HIV testing
potential risks such as discrimination. The client is also informed about their right to refuse, follow-up services . Pregnant
women are given additional information on nutrition, hygiene, the importance of an
institutional delivery and HIV testing so as to avoid HIV transmission from mother to child.

name: Post test counselling given as per protocol
meansOfVerification:
window period, a repeat test is recommended, clients with suspected tuberculosis are referred to the nearest microscopy centre. In case of a positive test result, the counsellor assists the client to understand the   
implications of the positive test result and helps in coping with the test result. The   
counsellor also ensures access to treatment and care, and supports disclosure of the HIV   
status to the spouse.
